sen.j: この後、10年以上にわたって続く桂園時代の初めの内閣である。
sen.e: That was the first cabinet of Kei-En era (Katsura-Saionji era) that lasted for more than ten years.

sen.j: 前の第4次伊藤内閣の崩壊後、当初井上馨に大命降下された。
sen.e: Soon after the collapse of the fourth Ito Cabinet, Kaoru INOUE was appointed to form his cabinet.
Soon after the collapse of the fourth Ito Cabinet, Kaoru INOUE was appointed at first to form his cabinet.
sen.cmt: 「当初」訳漏れのため、at first を追記して対応しました。
sen.e: Soon after the collapse of the fourth Ito Cabinet, Kaoru INOUE was appointed at first to form his cabinet.

sen.j: が、期待していた渋沢栄一の大蔵大臣就任が実現せず、同じく立憲政友会も混乱状態にあったため、井上は組閣辞退を表明した。
sen.e: However, INOUE declined forming his cabinet partly because Eichi SHIBUSAWA did not become Minister of Finance against INOUE's expectation, and partly because Rikken Seiyukai (a political party organized by Hirobumi ITO) was in chaos.

However, Inoue declined forming his cabinet partly because Eichi SHIBUSAWA did not become Minister of Finance against Inoue's expectation, and partly because Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government Party) was in chaos.

sen.e: However, Inoue declined forming his cabinet partly because Eichi SHIBUSAWA did not become Minister of Finance against Inoue's expectation, and partly because Rikken Seiyukai (Friends of Constitutional Government Party) was in chaos.

sen.j: 元勲世代からの総理大臣擁立は困難と考えた元老によって、新たに推されたのが桂であった。
sen.e: Genro (elder statesman) thought it almost impossible to elect a Prime Minister from the generation of Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in Meiji Restoration), so they decided to chose KATSURA.
Genro (elder statesman) thought it almost impossible to elect a Prime Minister from the generation of Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in Meiji Restoration), so they decided to chose Katsura.

sen.e: Genro (elder statesman) thought it almost impossible to elect a Prime Minister from the generation of Genkun (the statesmen who contributed in Meiji Restoration), so they decided to chose Katsura.

sen.j: 山縣有朋系官僚を中心とした内閣であり、「二流内閣」と揶揄された。
sen.e: Since the major members of the cabinet were the bureaucrats who were following Aritomo YAMAGATA, the cabinet was criticized as 'the second-rate cabinet."
Since the major members of the cabinet were the bureaucrats who were following Aritomo YAMAGATA, the cabinet was criticized as 'the second-rate cabinet.'

sen.j: 議会における与党は帝国党のみであり、伊藤博文の立憲政友会と大隈重信の憲政本党は野党に回った。
sen.e: The ruling party in the Congress was only the Empire party and Rikken seiyukai led by Hirobumi ITO and Kenseihonto-party led by Shigenobu OKUMA were the opposition parties.
sen.cmt: 「帝国党」「憲政本党」の英訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: The ruling party in the Congress was only the Teikokuto (Imperialist party) and the Rikken Seiyukai led by Hirobumi ITO and the Kensei Honto (True Constitutional party) led by Shigenobu OKUMA were the opposition parties.

The ruling party in the Congress was only the Teikokuto (Imperialist party) and the Rikken Seiyukai led by Hirobumi ITO and the Kensei Honto (True Constitutional party) led by Shigenobu OKUMA were the opposition parties.

sen.j: 伊藤博文の立憲政友会は軍備増強の必要性は認めたものの、桂の進める地租増徴ではなく行財政改革の徹底を求めた。
sen.e: Although Rikken Seiyukai (the Seiyu party) led by Hirobumi Ito admitted the necessity of Japan's military expansion, they required a thorough administrative and financial reform, not increased land taxes, which Katsura was going to promote.

Although Rikken Seiyukai led by Hirobumi ITO admitted the necessity of Japan's military expansion, they required a thorough administrative and financial reform, not increased land taxes, which Katsura was going to promote.
sen.cmt: (the Seiyu party) を削除しました。Ito を ITO に修正しました。
sen.e: Although Rikken Seiyukai led by Hirobumi ITO admitted the necessity of Japan's military expansion, they required a thorough administrative and financial reform, not increased land taxes, which Katsura was going to promote.

sen.j: だが、親政友会の奥田義人法制局長官による行財政改革案を葬って辞任に追い込んだことが伊藤を含めた政友会の怒りを買って内閣を攻撃し、一時は大日本帝国憲法の停止を検討する程（5月19日山縣有朋宛の桂書簡（「山縣有朋文書」））の危機的状況を迎えていた。
sen.e: That cabinet disapproved of the administrative and financial reform plan, which was made by Yoshihito OKUDA, the Director-General of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, and made him resign; ITO and other members of the Seiyu party were enraged by that and attacked the cabinet, which led to such a critical situation as the Constitution of the Empire of Japan might be abondoned (from KATSURA's letter to Aritomo YAMAGATA on May 19 ('Aritomo YAMAGATA monjo (written materials)')).
sen.cmt: 「奥田義人」の読み方が確認できませんでした。また、「山縣有朋文書」の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: That cabinet disapproved of the administrative and financial reform plan, which was made by Yoshihito OKUDA, the Director-General of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, and made him resign; Ito and other members of the Seiyu party were enraged by that and attacked the cabinet, which led to such a critical situation as the Constitution of the Empire of Japan might be abandoned (from Katsura's letter to Aritomo YAMAGATA on May 19 ('Aritomo YAMAGATA monjo' [written materials]).
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。コーテーションを修正しました。abondoned を abandoned に修正しました。
sen.e: That cabinet disapproved of the administrative and financial reform plan, which was made by Yoshihito OKUDA, the Director-General of the Cabinet Legislation Bureau, and made him resign; Ito and other members of the Seiyu party were enraged by that and attacked the cabinet, which led to such a critical situation as the Constitution of the Empire of Japan might be abandoned (from Katsura's letter to Aritomo YAMAGATA on May 19 ('Aritomo YAMAGATA monjo' [written materials]).

sen.j: 桂はこの事態を乗り切るために外交では日英同盟を締結してロシア帝国との対決姿勢を強め、内政では伊藤博文を枢密院議長に祭り上げて政友会総裁を辞めさせることに成功した。
sen.e: In order to weather that crisis, KATSURA took a more clearly adversarial stand against the Russian Empire by concluding the Anglo-Japanese Alliance; he also succeeded in having Hirobumi ITO resigning his position as the president of the (Rikken) Seiyu party by making ITO Chair of the Privy Council.

In order to weather that crisis, Katsura took a more clearly adversarial stand against the Russian Empire by concluding the Anglo-Japanese Alliance; he also succeeded in having Hirobumi ITO resigning his position as the president of the (Rikken) Seiyu party by kicking him up to chairman of the Privy Council.
sen.cmt: 苗字のみの表記を語頭のみ大文字に修正しました。by making 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: In order to weather that crisis, Katsura took a more clearly adversarial stand against the Russian Empire by concluding the Anglo-Japanese Alliance; he also succeeded in having Hirobumi ITO resigning his position as the president of the (Rikken) Seiyu party by kicking him up to chairman of the Privy Council.

sen.j: だが、政友会は代わりに総裁になった西園寺公望の元で党内融和が進んでいくことになった。
sen.e: The Seiyu party promoted its intra party harmony under the leadership of Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became the president of the party.
The Seiyu party promoted its intra party harmony under the leadership of Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became the president of the party.
The Seiyu party promoted its intra party harmony under the leadership of Kinmochi SAIONJI, who became the president of the party.

sen.j: 第1次桂内閣における最大の事跡は日露戦争である。
sen.e: The greatest achievement of the First Katsura Cabinet was the Russo-Japanese War.
The greatest achievement of the First Katsura Cabinet was the Russo-Japanese War.
The greatest achievement of the First Katsura Cabinet was the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.j: 桂太郎首相は、戦争中の政局の安定を図るため、立憲政友会との提携を希望して原敬との間で次の政権は政友会総裁の西園寺公望に禅譲するという政権授受の密約を交わす（ただし近年の原と桂の双方の日記の研究によって、当初はその時期を明確にしていなかったこと、日比谷焼討事件後の桂内閣の弱体化に危機感を抱いた双方の合意によって具体的な時期が定まったことが明らかになっている）。
sen.e: Taro KATSURA, Prime Minister, expected the alliance with the Seiyu party in order to stabilize the political situation during the war and made a secret promise with Takashi HARA that he would transfer the position of Prime Minister to SAIONJI; (however, the recent study on the diaries kept by HARA and KATSURA proved that, at first, they did not clarify the date of transfer and that they decided the date, with a sense of crisis about the weakened KATSURA cabinet after the incident of attacking and burning Hibiya.)
sen.cmt: 「日比谷焼討事件」の定訳が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: Taro KATSURA, Prime Minister, expected the alliance with the Seiyu party in order to stabilize the political situation during the war and made a secret promise with Takashi HARA that he would transfer the position of Prime Minister to Saionji (however, the recent study on the diaries kept by Hara and Katsura proved that, at first, they did not clarify the date of transfer and that they decided the date, with a sense of crisis about the weakened Katsura cabinet after the Hibiya Incendiary Incident).

sen.j: 政友会の支持を得た第1次桂内閣は日露戦争を乗り切る。
sen.e: The First Katsura Cabinet, which was supported by the Seiyu party, weathered the Russo-Japanese War.
The First Katsura Cabinet, which was supported by the Seiyu party, weathered the Russo-Japanese War.

sen.j: だが、多くの死傷者と度重なる非常特別税などの増税に苦しんだ民衆の不満は日比谷焼討事件となって爆発した。
sen.e: However, since many were killed or injured in the war or/and suffered from repeated emergency taxes, their frustration and fury led to the incident of attacking and burning Hibiya.

sen.e: However, since many were killed or injured in the war and people suffered from repeated tax increase such as emergency special taxes, their frustration and fury led to the Hibiya Incendiary Incident.

sen.j: また外交面ではポーツマス条約・第2次日韓協約・日清満州善後条約の締結によって一応の役割を果たした。
sen.e: The cabinet fulfilled its role to some extent; it concluded the Treaty of Portsmouth, the Eulsa Treaty and Japan-China-Manchuria Treaty.
sen.cmt: 「日清満州善後条約」の定訳が確認できませんでした。一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: このため、1905年（明治38年）12月に総辞職して、約束通りに西園寺公望に組閣の大命が下ることとなった。
sen.e: The cabinet resigned en masse in December, 1905 and the imperial command to form a cabinet was given to Kinmochi SAIONJI, as it had been promised.
The cabinet resigned en masse in December, 1905 and the imperial command to form a cabinet was given to Kinmochi SAIONJI, as it had been promised.

sen.j: その在任期間は1681日で、1つの内閣としては日本憲政史上最長である。
sen.e: KATSURA was in office for 1,681 days, the longest for one cabinet in Japanese political history.
Katsura was in office for 1,681 days, the longest for one cabinet in Japanese political history.
sen.cmt: KATSURA を Katsura に修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、元老・山縣有朋に支えられた桂と元老・伊藤博文に支えられた西園寺が交互に首班となって組閣したことから、の日露戦争後から、の大正二年の政変までの時期を桂園時代（けいえんじだい）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Thereafter, the time from the end of Russo-Japanese war and the coup in 1913 was called Kei-En era (Katsura-Saionji era): KATSURA, supported by Aritomo YAMAGATA, a Genro and SIONJI, supported by Hirobumi ITO, another Genro, took turns becoming a Prime Minister and forming his cabinet.
